metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2550 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 4.5 allows local users to bypass file-descriptorlimits and cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by leveragingincorrect tracking of descriptor ownership and sending each descriptor overa UNIX socket before closing it. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because ofan incorrect fix for CVE-2013-4312.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2550` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-85-generic - 3.13.0-85.129
linux-image-3.13.0-85-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-85.129
linux-image-3.13.0-85-lowlatency - 3.13.0-85.129

linux-image-3.13.0-85-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-85.129
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-85-generic - 3.13.0-85.129

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-85.129').
